line.words: Era viernes por la tarde, Rubén se sentó silenciosamente mientras los otros niños del colegio estaban hablando sobre el fin de semana.

line.words: “¡Vaya, eso suena divertido!” contestó Daisy. “El sábado bailo y como caramelos, es genial.”

subtitle.line: “Wow, that sounds like fun”, replied Daisy. “On Sunday I dance and eat sweets, it is great.§

Félix se tourna vers son ami Jean. §Que fais-tu pendant le weekend, Jean?§
Felix turned to his friend Juan, “what do you do at the weekend, Juan?”
Felix turned to his friend Juan, “what do you do at the weekend, Juan?”

line.words: “El sábado juego al golf y el domingo hago judo” contestó Juan. “Como pescado y patatas fritas y bebo coca cola, es genial.”

subtitle.line: “On Saturday I play golf and on Sunday I do judo,” replied Juan. “I eat fish and chips and I drink cola. It is great.”
“On Saturday I play golf and on Sunday I do judo,” replied Juan. “I eat fish and chips and I drink cola. It is great.”

line.words: Ana empezó a contarle a todo el mundo su fin de semana, “el sábado juego al bádminton y monto a caballo, como muchas manzanas y yogur. El domingo juego al fútbol y al cricket.”

subtitle.line: Anna started telling everyone about her weekend, “on Saturday I play badminton and I go horseriding, I eat lots of apples and yoghurt. On Sunday I play football and cricket.”

line.words: Rubén sonrió y se levantó, sujetando el modelo que había estado haciendo. Gruñó §hago monstruos”

subtitle.line: Reuben smiled and stood up, holding out the model he had been making. He growled “I make monsters!”

line.words: Todos sus amigos se rieron con Rubén y todos recogieron sus mochilas para ir a casa a pasar el de semana.

subtitle.line: All his friends laughed with Reuben and everyone picked up their bags to go home for the weekend.
